title: Mika logo character font ID
content:
Hello:

Perhaps someone has seen this font before, any kind of help would be appreciated...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090503110011im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Mika_3831.jpg)

The Heart and flower shouldn’t be part of the original typeface...

Thanks in advance...

Q™ says: It’s all about the fonts!
author: Qdzign.com.mx

comments.content:
Do you know for sure that this is a font and not a custom-drawn logo?

- Lex

[Billy](http://web.archive.org/web/20090503110011/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/sparkytype/billy/) from Sparkytype is pretty similar in the heaviest weight.

- Mike Yanega

Hello guys:

I’m not sure about the facts of this logo, don’t know if it’s a custom draw, I prefer to think that the designer used some already designed font, I guess that Billy would do the job, thanks for putting me in the right direction!

Q™ Says: It’s All About The Fonts!

I think it is custom too, but there a lot of pizzadude fonts in this late ’50s to early ’70s cartoon style such as [Eyeful](http://web.archive.org/web/20090503110011/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/pizzadude/eyeful/) and [Skramp](http://web.archive.org/web/20090503110011/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/pizzadude/skramp/). Font Bureau’s [Asphalt](http://web.archive.org/web/20090503110011/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/asphalt/) is very nice.

Hi Guys:

I have to accept that there’s a high probability that this is, in fact, a custom job, since the Mika character is part of a beach themed clothing brand, called “Señor Frogs” and they have very creative designers around them, so, let’s leave this way, I just wanted something similar to the font used in the character logo, and I get what I needed thanks to you guys :-D...

Thanks a lot...

Q™ Says: It’s All About The Fonts!
